pullrequest.title: Teleop of a team of Jackal, Husky, and Iris (in a dark lava tube)

content.raw:
I was testing with Tetsuya and we have identified two main issues:

1. The robot lights associated to the flashlights are not loaded.
2. The teleoperation expects the keypad to be in `X` mode but usually we operate in `D` mode.

Based on some testing, it seems that some changes after Gazebo `9.1.1` are generating problem \(1\). I suggest to test before and after [this pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2871/attach-lights-to-links-cleanup-and/diff) in Gazebo for trying to find the issue.
content.html:
I was testing with Tetsuya and we have identified two main issues:

  1. The robot lights associated to the flashlights are not loaded.
  2. The teleoperation expects the keypad to be in X mode but usually we operate in D mode.

Based on some testing, it seems that some changes after Gazebo 9.1.1 are generating problem (1). I suggest to test before and after this pull request in Gazebo for trying to find the issue.

pullrequest.title: Teleop of a team of Jackal, Husky, and Iris (in a dark lava tube)

content.raw:
I reconfigured the joypad settings so D mode can work: [#!/osrf/subt/commits/c272a5bac1e47d8422696281a2dcdb4f011ea911](#!/osrf/subt/commits/c272a5bac1e47d8422696281a2dcdb4f011ea911)

As for the issue #1, I noticed that a light object in a sdf file does not appear if it is to be spawned by `spawn_model` or the “insert” option of the Gazebo. This problem does not appear at 9.1.1, but after this version. I will check more details, but appreciate any comments or advice.

**Update: **Apparently, when a model with a light object is being spawned, a message is not sent to `~/factory/light` topic in Gazebo.
content.html:
I reconfigured the joypad settings so D mode can work: #!/osrf/subt/commits/c272a5bac1e47d8422696281a2dcdb4f011ea911

As for the issue #1, I noticed that a light object in a sdf file does not appear if it is to be spawned by spawn_model or the “insert” option of the Gazebo. This problem does not appear at 9.1.1, but after this version. I will check more details, but appreciate any comments or advice.

Update: Apparently, when a model with a light object is being spawned, a message is not sent to ~/factory/light topic in Gazebo.

pullrequest.title: Teleop of a team of Jackal, Husky, and Iris (in a dark lava tube)

content.raw: Update: I verified that the two issues have been fixed now.
content.html: Update: I verified that the two issues have been fixed now.

pullrequest.title: Teleop of a team of Jackal, Husky, and Iris (in a dark lava tube)

content.raw: Can't we use the file provided by `husky_description` instead? Not sure why we need a custom version now. The same comment applies to Jackal.
content.html: Can't we use the file provided by husky_description instead? Not sure why we need a custom version now. The same comment applies to Jackal.

pullrequest.title: Teleop of a team of Jackal, Husky, and Iris (in a dark lava tube)

content.raw:
I remember about Jackal that its `description.launch` does not accept urdf models \(i.e., flashlight and LED\) from outside of the package. I think it is the same reason for Husky, but I will double-check it.

Maybe, there is another way to equip the flashlights.
content.html:
I remember about Jackal that its description.launch does not accept urdf models (i.e., flashlight and LED) from outside of the package. I think it is the same reason for Husky, but I will double-check it.

Maybe, there is another way to equip the flashlights.

pullrequest.title: Teleop of a team of Jackal, Husky, and Iris (in a dark lava tube)

content.raw:
As for Husky, its `description.launch` accepts extra urdf files but does not maintain robot’s name space and, if more than one Husky is spawn, all of them would have the same topic names in default. There is an option about “multimaster bringup”. I am not sure if it could provide separate name spaces, but I will take a look.

**Update:** As I tried to use "multimaster" we need a package `multimaster_launch`, which is not available for melodic now. Plus, still don’t know if this package could provide distinct topic names. At the moment, I think we need custom launch files…
content.html:
As for Husky, its description.launch accepts extra urdf files but does not maintain robot’s name space and, if more than one Husky is spawn, all of them would have the same topic names in default. There is an option about “multimaster bringup”. I am not sure if it could provide separate name spaces, but I will take a look.

Update: As I tried to use "multimaster" we need a package multimaster_launch, which is not available for melodic now. Plus, still don’t know if this package could provide distinct topic names. At the moment, I think we need custom launch files…

pullrequest.title: Teleop of a team of Jackal, Husky, and Iris (in a dark lava tube)

content.raw: I’m not superfamiliar with xacro but there’s some repetition in every flashlight. just wondering if it’s possible to move these blocks inside the xacro macro and use the parameters to avoid repetition.
content.html: I’m not superfamiliar with xacro but there’s some repetition in every flashlight. just wondering if it’s possible to move these blocks inside the xacro macro and use the parameters to avoid repetition.

pullrequest.title: Teleop of a team of Jackal, Husky, and Iris (in a dark lava tube)

content.raw: Yeah, I think I can. :slight_smile:
content.html: Yeah, I think I can.

pullrequest.title: Teleop of a team of Jackal, Husky, and Iris (in a dark lava tube)

content.raw:
Apparently, xacro's macro accepts an empty block parameter but still needs an empty block like `<params></params>`. I updated the xacro files as the default settings \(constant white light\) are overwritten when the block parameter has some values.

[#!/osrf/subt/commits/99014ea426db8d183a4b162305873edff6686e61?at=default](#!/osrf/subt/commits/99014ea426db8d183a4b162305873edff6686e61?at=default)
content.html:
Apparently, xacro's macro accepts an empty block parameter but still needs an empty block like <params></params>. I updated the xacro files as the default settings (constant white light) are overwritten when the block parameter has some values.

#!/osrf/subt/commits/99014ea426db8d183a4b162305873edff6686e61?at=default
